intro: Linum kurdicum, commonly known as Kurdish flax, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey and Iran. It belongs to the genus Linum, which includes other species of flax known for their blue or white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and produces small, delicate flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Kurdish flax is adapted to rocky and arid environments, making it a hardy species found in high-altitude regions.
